AcceptInquiredSystemEvent.title: AcceptInquiredSystemEvent
AcceptInquiredSystemEvent.summary: Accepts the default operation for a system event in the Inquiring state and authorizes the system to perform the operation.

AddTags.title: AddTags
AddTags.summary: Adds tags to Elastic Compute Service (ECS) resources, or overwrites tags of ECS resources. You can add tags to ECS resources such as instances, disks, snapshots, images, and security groups for easy management.

AllocateDedicatedHosts.title: AllocateDedicatedHosts
AllocateDedicatedHosts.summary: Creates pay-as-you-go or subscription dedicated hosts. A dedicated host is a physical server dedicated to a single tenant. You can create Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances on a dedicated host and view the attributes of a dedicated host.

AllocatePublicIpAddress.title: AllocatePublicIpAddress
AllocatePublicIpAddress.summary: Assigns a static public IP address (also called system-assigned public IP address or auto-assigned public IP address) to an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance.

ApplyAutoSnapshotPolicy.title: ApplyAutoSnapshotPolicy
ApplyAutoSnapshotPolicy.summary: Applies an automatic snapshot policy to one or more cloud disks. You can call this operation to replace the automatic snapshot policy of a cloud disk.

AssignIpv6Addresses.title: AssignIpv6Addresses
AssignIpv6Addresses.summary: Assigns one or more IPv6 addresses to an elastic network interface (ENI).

AssignPrivateIpAddresses.title: AssignPrivateIpAddresses
AssignPrivateIpAddresses.summary: Assigns secondary private IP addresses to an elastic network interface (ENI). You can specify available private IP addresses within the CIDR block of the vSwitch that is connected to the ENI. Alternatively, you can specify the number of private IP addresses that are automatically assigned from the CIDR block of the vSwitch to the ENI.

AttachClassicLinkVpc.title: AttachClassicLinkVpc
AttachClassicLinkVpc.summary: Links an instance that is deployed in the classic network to a virtual private cloud (VPC) by establishing a ClassicLink connection between the instance and the VPC. This way, the instance can communicate with cloud resources in the VPC over the internal network.

AttachDisk.title: AttachDisk
AttachDisk.summary: Attaches a pay-as-you-go data disk or a system disk to an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance.

AttachInstanceRamRole.title: AttachInstanceRamRole
AttachInstanceRamRole.summary: Attaches an instance Resource Access Management (RAM) role to Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances.

AttachKeyPair.title: AttachKeyPair
AttachKeyPair.summary: Binds an SSH key pair to one or more Linux instances.

AttachNetworkInterface.title: AttachNetworkInterface
AttachNetworkInterface.summary: Attaches an elastic network interface (ENI) to an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance that resides in a virtual private cloud (VPC). When you call this operation, you can specify parameters, such as NetworkInterfaceId, InstanceId, and NetworkCardIndex, in the request.

AuthorizeSecurityGroup.title: AuthorizeSecurityGroup
AuthorizeSecurityGroup.summary: Creates inbound security group rules in a security group. You can use the created rules to allow or deny inbound traffic from other objects to Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances in the security group for fine-grained network access control.

AuthorizeSecurityGroupEgress.title: AuthorizeSecurityGroupEgress
AuthorizeSecurityGroupEgress.summary: Creates outbound rules in a security group. You can use the created rules to allow or deny outbound traffic from Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances in the security group to other objects for fine-grained network access control.

CancelAutoSnapshotPolicy.title: CancelAutoSnapshotPolicy
CancelAutoSnapshotPolicy.summary: Disables an automatic snapshot policy for one or more cloud disks.

CancelCopyImage.title: CancelCopyImage
CancelCopyImage.summary: Cancels an ongoing image copy task.

CancelSimulatedSystemEvents.title: CancelSimulatedSystemEvents
CancelSimulatedSystemEvents.summary: Cancels simulated system events that are in the Scheduled or Executing state. After you cancel a simulated system event, the simulated event enters the Canceled state.

CancelTask.title: CancelTask
CancelTask.summary: Cancels a running task. You can cancel the running tasks generated by the ImportImage or ExportImage operation.

ConvertNatPublicIpToEip.title: ConvertNatPublicIpToEip
ConvertNatPublicIpToEip.summary: Converts the static public IP address of an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance that resides in a virtual private cloud (VPC) into an elastic IP address (EIP). Static public IP addresses are the public IP addresses that are automatically assigned to ECS instances.

CopyImage.title: CopyImage
CopyImage.summary: Copies a custom image from one region to another region. You can copy custom images to deploy or copy Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances across regions.

CopySnapshot.title: CopySnapshot
CopySnapshot.summary: Copies a standard or encrypted snapshot from one region to another.

CreateActivation.title: CreateActivation
CreateActivation.summary: Creates an activation code. The activation code is used to register servers that are not provided by Alibaba Cloud as Alibaba Cloud managed instances.

CreateAutoSnapshotPolicy.title: CreateAutoSnapshotPolicy
CreateAutoSnapshotPolicy.summary: Creates an automatic snapshot policy in a specific region. You can specify the schedule on which to create automatic snapshots, the retention period of the automatic snapshots, and whether to enable cross-region replication for the snapshots in the automatic snapshot policy. The automatic snapshot policy can be applied to create snapshots for system disks or data disks to back up disk data.

CreateCommand.title: CreateCommand
CreateCommand.summary: Creates a Cloud Assistant command, which can be a Shell, PowerShell, or batch command.

CreateDeploymentSet.title: CreateDeploymentSet
CreateDeploymentSet.summary: Creates a deployment set in a region.

CreateDiagnosticMetricSet.title: CreateDiagnosticMetricSet
CreateDiagnosticMetricSet.summary: Creates a diagnostic metric set. You can group diagnostic metrics into diagnostic metric sets.

CreateDiagnosticReport.title: CreateDiagnosticReport
CreateDiagnosticReport.summary: Creates a diagnostic report for a resource. When you call this operation, you can configure the MetricSetId parameter to create a diagnostic report based on the specified diagnostic metric set. Then, you can call the DescribeDiagnosticReportAttributes operation based on the returned diagnostic report ID to view the details of the diagnostic report.

CreateDisk.title: CreateDisk
CreateDisk.summary: Creates a pay-as-you-go or subscription data disk.

CreateElasticityAssurance.title: CreateElasticityAssurance
CreateElasticityAssurance.summary: Creates an elasticity assurance in a region. When you call this operation, you can specify parameters, such as ZoneId, InstanceType, Period, PeriodUnit, and AutoRenew, in the request.

CreateHpcCluster.title: CreateHpcCluster
CreateHpcCluster.summary: Creates a high performance computing (HPC) cluster.

CreateImage.title: CreateImage
CreateImage.summary: Creates a custom image. After you call this operation to create a custom image, you can call the RunInstances operation to create Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances from the custom image or call the ReplaceSystemDisk operation to replace system disks by using the custom image.

CreateImageComponent.title: CreateImageComponent
CreateImageComponent.summary: Creates an image component. Image components are used to store the builder template commands that are commonly used when you create images.

CreateImagePipeline.title: CreateImagePipeline
CreateImagePipeline.summary: Creates an image template. Image templates can be used to create images.

CreateInstance.title: CreateInstance
CreateInstance.summary: Creates a subscription or pay-as-you-go Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance. When you call this operation, you can specify different parameters to create instances based on your business requirements.

CreateKeyPair.title: CreateKeyPair
CreateKeyPair.summary: Creates an SSH key pair. The system stores the public key and returns the unencrypted private key. The private key is encoded with PEM in the PKCS#8 format. You must properly store the private key and ensure its confidentiality.

CreateLaunchTemplate.title: CreateLaunchTemplate
CreateLaunchTemplate.summary: Creates a launch template. A launch template eliminates the need to configure a large number of parameters every time you create an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance.

CreateLaunchTemplateVersion.title: CreateLaunchTemplateVersion
CreateLaunchTemplateVersion.summary: Creates a version for a launch template. You can use the created version to create Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances, scaling groups, or auto provisioning groups.

CreateNetworkInterface.title: CreateNetworkInterface
CreateNetworkInterface.summary: Creates an elastic network interface (ENI). You can specify an IP address as the primary private IP address of the ENI.

CreateNetworkInterfacePermission.title: CreateNetworkInterfacePermission
CreateNetworkInterfacePermission.summary: Grants a permission on an elastic network interface (ENI) to an Alibaba Cloud partner (a certified ISV) or an individual user.

CreatePortRangeList.title: CreatePortRangeList
CreatePortRangeList.summary: Creates a port list. You can associate a port list with resources, such as security groups.

CreateSimulatedSystemEvents.title: CreateSimulatedSystemEvents
CreateSimulatedSystemEvents.summary: Schedules simulated system events of Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances. The simulated system events do not actually occur on or affect ECS instances.

CreateSnapshot.title: CreateSnapshot
CreateSnapshot.summary: Creates a snapshot for a cloud disk.

CreateSnapshotGroup.title: CreateSnapshotGroup
CreateSnapshotGroup.summary: Creates a snapshot-consistent group for the disks of an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance. A snapshot-consistent group contains snapshots of one or more disks.

DeleteAutoProvisioningGroup.title: DeleteAutoProvisioningGroup
DeleteAutoProvisioningGroup.summary: Deletes an auto provisioning group. When you call this operation, you can specify AutoProvisioningGroupId and TerminateInstances in the request.

DeleteAutoSnapshotPolicy.title: DeleteAutoSnapshotPolicy
DeleteAutoSnapshotPolicy.summary: Deletes an automatic snapshot policy. After you delete an automatic snapshot policy, the policy is no longer applied to the disks on which it previously took effect.

DeleteCommand.title: DeleteCommand
DeleteCommand.summary: Deletes a Cloud Assistant command in a region. This operation cannot delete Cloud Assistant commands that are being run.

DeleteDedicatedHostCluster.title: DeleteDedicatedHostCluster
DeleteDedicatedHostCluster.summary: Deletes a dedicated host group. Before you call the API operation, you must migrate the dedicated hosts in the host group to another host group.

DeleteDisk.title: DeleteDisk
DeleteDisk.summary: Deletes a pay-as-you-go data disk. The data disk can be a basic disk, an ultra disk, a standard SSD, or an Enterprise SSD (ESSD).

DeleteHpcCluster.title: DeleteHpcCluster
DeleteHpcCluster.summary: Deletes a high performance computing (HPC) cluster.

DeleteImage.title: DeleteImage
DeleteImage.summary: Deletes a custom image. When you call this operation, you can specify ImageId and Force in the request.

DeleteImageComponent.title: DeleteImageComponent
DeleteImageComponent.summary: Deletes an image component. You can specify RegionId and ImageComponentId in the request.

DeleteInstance.title: DeleteInstance
DeleteInstance.summary: Deletes or releases a pay-as-you-go Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance or an expired subscription ECS instance. You can configure parameters to specify whether to release the disks attached to the instance or retain the disks as pay-as-you-go disks.

DeleteInstances.title: DeleteInstances
DeleteInstances.summary: Releases multiple pay-as-you-go Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances or expired subscription ECS instances at a time. You can configure parameters to specify whether to release the disks attached to the instances or retain the disks as pay-as-you-go disks.

DeleteKeyPairs.title: DeleteKeyPairs
DeleteKeyPairs.summary: Deletes one or more SSH key pairs.

DeleteLaunchTemplate.title: DeleteLaunchTemplate
DeleteLaunchTemplate.summary: Deletes a launch template. You can use the LaunchTemplateId or LaunchTemplateName parameter to specify the launch template that you want to delete from the specified region.

DeleteLaunchTemplateVersion.title: DeleteLaunchTemplateVersion
DeleteLaunchTemplateVersion.summary: Deletes versions of a launch template. When you call this operation, you can specify parameters, such as LaunchTemplateId and DeleteVersion, in the request.

DeleteNetworkInterface.title: DeleteNetworkInterface
DeleteNetworkInterface.summary: Deletes an elastic network interface (ENI) in a region. DeleteNetworkInterface is an asynchronous operation.

DeletePortRangeList.title: DeletePortRangeList
DeletePortRangeList.summary: Deletes a port list and all entries in the port list.

DeletePrefixList.title: DeletePrefixList
DeletePrefixList.summary: Deletes a prefix list and all entries in the prefix list.

DeleteSecurityGroup.title: DeleteSecurityGroup
DeleteSecurityGroup.summary: Deletes a security group and all security group rules in the security group.

DeleteSnapshot.title: DeleteSnapshot
DeleteSnapshot.summary: Deletes a specified snapshot. If you call this operation to delete a snapshot that is being created, the associated snapshot creation task is also canceled.

DeregisterManagedInstance.title: DeregisterManagedInstance
DeregisterManagedInstance.summary: Deregisters a managed instance. After you deregister the managed instance, you can no longer use Cloud Assistant to send commands or files to the instance.

DescribeAccountAttributes.title: DescribeAccountAttributes
DescribeAccountAttributes.summary: Queries the quotas of Elastic Compute Service (ECS) resources that you can create in an Alibaba Cloud region. For a specific region, you can query the maximum numbers of security groups, elastic network interfaces (ENIs), vCPUs for pay-as-you-go instances, vCPUs for spot instances, and dedicated hosts that you can create and the capacity quotas for pay-as-you-go disks that you can create. You can also query information such as network types or whether an account has completed the account verification.

DescribeActivations.title: DescribeActivations
DescribeActivations.summary: Queries existing activation codes and their usage information.

DescribeAutoProvisioningGroupHistory.title: DescribeAutoProvisioningGroupHistory
DescribeAutoProvisioningGroupHistory.summary: Queries the scheduling tasks of an auto provisioning group.

DescribeAutoProvisioningGroupInstances.title: DescribeAutoProvisioningGroupInstances
DescribeAutoProvisioningGroupInstances.summary: Queries information about Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances in an auto provisioning group.

DescribeAutoProvisioningGroups.title: DescribeAutoProvisioningGroups
DescribeAutoProvisioningGroups.summary: Queries information about one or more auto provisioning groups.

DescribeAutoSnapshotPolicyAssociations.title: DescribeAutoSnapshotPolicyAssociations
DescribeAutoSnapshotPolicyAssociations.summary: Queries association relationships of automatic snapshot policies.

DescribeAutoSnapshotPolicyEx.title: DescribeAutoSnapshotPolicyEx
DescribeAutoSnapshotPolicyEx.summary: Queries the details of automatic snapshot policies that are created in a specific region.

DescribeAvailableResource.title: DescribeAvailableResource
DescribeAvailableResource.summary: Queries resources in a zone. You can query the resources available in a zone before you create Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances by calling the RunInstances operation or before you change instance types by calling the ModifyInstanceSpec operation.

DescribeBandwidthLimitation.title: DescribeBandwidthLimitation
DescribeBandwidthLimitation.summary: Queries the maximum public bandwidth that can be purchased, upgraded, or downgraded for various Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance types.

DescribeCapacityReservationInstances.title: DescribeCapacityReservationInstances
DescribeCapacityReservationInstances.summary: Queries the Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances that match a capacity reservation.

DescribeCapacityReservations.title: DescribeCapacityReservations
DescribeCapacityReservations.summary: Queries the details of capacity reservations.

DescribeClassicLinkInstances.title: DescribeClassicLinkInstances
DescribeClassicLinkInstances.summary: Queries instances located in the classic network that have established ClassicLink connections to virtual private clouds (VPCs).

DescribeCloudAssistantSettings.title: DescribeCloudAssistantSettings
DescribeCloudAssistantSettings.summary: Queries the configurations of Cloud Assistant features.

DescribeCloudAssistantStatus.title: DescribeCloudAssistantStatus
DescribeCloudAssistantStatus.summary: Queries whether Cloud Assistant Agent is installed on instances. If Cloud Assistant Agent is installed, the system queries the total number of Cloud Assistant commands that have been run, the number of Cloud Assistant commands that are being run, and the time when Cloud Assistant commands were last run.

DescribeCommands.title: DescribeCommands
DescribeCommands.summary: Queries the Cloud Assistant commands that you created or the common Cloud Assistant commands that Alibaba Cloud provides.

DescribeDedicatedHostAutoRenew.title: DescribeDedicatedHostAutoRenew
DescribeDedicatedHostAutoRenew.summary: Queries the auto-renewal status of one or more subscription dedicated hosts.

DescribeDedicatedHostClusters.title: DescribeDedicatedHostClusters
DescribeDedicatedHostClusters.summary: Queries the details of one or more dedicated host groups.

DescribeDedicatedHostTypes.title: DescribeDedicatedHostTypes
DescribeDedicatedHostTypes.summary: Queries the details of dedicated host types supported in a region, or the Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance families supported by a specific dedicated host type.

DescribeDedicatedHosts.title: DescribeDedicatedHosts
DescribeDedicatedHosts.summary: Queries the details of one or more Dedicated Hosts (DDHs). You can call this operation to obtain information about a DDH, including the physical performance specifications, machine code, service status, and the list of created ECS instances. You can specify relevant parameters, such as DDH IDs, DDH cluster IDs, hostname, and status, to query the required DDH details. This helps you efficiently manage and optimize cloud computing resources.

DescribeDeploymentSetSupportedInstanceTy.title: DescribeDeploymentSetSupportedInstanceTypeFamily
DescribeDeploymentSetSupportedInstanceTy.summary: Queries the instance families that support different deployment strategies. When you call this operation, specify parameters, such as RegionId and Strategy, in the request.

DescribeDeploymentSets.title: DescribeDeploymentSets
DescribeDeploymentSets.summary: Queries detailed information about one or more deployment sets.

DescribeDiagnosticReportAttributes.title: DescribeDiagnosticReportAttributes
DescribeDiagnosticReportAttributes.summary: Queries the details of a diagnostic report.

DescribeDiskDefaultKMSKeyId.title: DescribeDiskDefaultKMSKeyId
DescribeDiskDefaultKMSKeyId.summary: Queries the Key Management Service (KMS) key used by the Account-level Elastic Block Storage (EBS) Default Encryption feature in a region.

DescribeDiskEncryptionByDefaultStatus.title: DescribeDiskEncryptionByDefaultStatus
DescribeDiskEncryptionByDefaultStatus.summary: Queries whether account-level default encryption of Elastic Block Storage (EBS) resources is enabled in a region.

DescribeDiskMonitorData.title: DescribeDiskMonitorData
DescribeDiskMonitorData.summary: Queries the monitoring data of a cloud disk within a specific period of time, such as the read IOPS, write IOPS, read bandwidth (byte/s), write bandwidth (byte/s), read latency (microseconds), and write latency (microseconds).

DescribeDisks.title: DescribeDisks
DescribeDisks.summary: Queries block storage devices that you created, including cloud disks, local disks, and elastic ephemeral disks.

DescribeDisksFullStatus.title: DescribeDisksFullStatus
DescribeDisksFullStatus.summary: Queries the full status information about one or more Elastic Block Storage (EBS) devices.

DescribeElasticityAssuranceAutoRenewAttr.title: DescribeElasticityAssuranceAutoRenewAttribute
DescribeElasticityAssuranceAutoRenewAttr.summary: Queries the auto-renewal attribute of elasticity assurances.

DescribeElasticityAssuranceInstances.title: DescribeElasticityAssuranceInstances
DescribeElasticityAssuranceInstances.summary: Queries the running Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances that use an elasticity assurance.

DescribeElasticityAssurances.title: DescribeElasticityAssurances
DescribeElasticityAssurances.summary: Queries the details of elasticity assurances.

DescribeEniMonitorData.title: DescribeEniMonitorData
DescribeEniMonitorData.summary: Queries the monitoring data of a secondary elastic network interface (ENI) over a specific period of time.

DescribeHpcClusters.title: DescribeHpcClusters
DescribeHpcClusters.summary: The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request. You can use the client to generate the token, but you must make sure that the token is unique among different requests. The \\*\\*token\\*\\* can contain only ASCII characters and cannot exceed 64 characters in length. For more information, see \\[How to ensure idempotence]\\(~~25693~~).

DescribeImageComponents.title: DescribeImageComponents
DescribeImageComponents.summary: Queries the details of one or more image components.

DescribeImageFromFamily.title: DescribeImageFromFamily
DescribeImageFromFamily.summary: Queries available custom images that are most recently created in a specific image family.

DescribeImagePipelineExecutions.title: DescribeImagePipelineExecutions
DescribeImagePipelineExecutions.summary: Queries the details of an image creation task.

DescribeImagePipelines.title: DescribeImagePipelines
DescribeImagePipelines.summary: Queries the details of one or more image templates.

DescribeImageSharePermission.title: DescribeImageSharePermission
DescribeImageSharePermission.summary: Queries the accounts with which a custom image is shared. When you call this operation, you can specify parameters, such as RegionId and ImageId, in the request. The response can be displayed by page. By default, 10 entries are displayed on each page.

DescribeImageSupportInstanceTypes.title: DescribeImageSupportInstanceTypes
DescribeImageSupportInstanceTypes.summary: Queries the Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance types supported by an image.

DescribeImages.title: DescribeImages
DescribeImages.summary: Queries image resources that you can use. You can specify parameters, such as ImageId, ActionType, and Filter, in the request.

DescribeInstanceAttachmentAttributes.title: DescribeInstanceAttachmentAttributes
DescribeInstanceAttachmentAttributes.summary: Queries the information about the private pools that Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances match.

DescribeInstanceAttribute.title: DescribeInstanceAttribute
DescribeInstanceAttribute.summary: Queries the attributes of a specific Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance.

DescribeInstanceAutoRenewAttribute.title: DescribeInstanceAutoRenewAttribute
DescribeInstanceAutoRenewAttribute.summary: Queries the auto-renewal attribute of subscription Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances, including whether auto-renewal is enabled for the instances and the auto-renewal durations of the instances.

DescribeInstanceHistoryEvents.title: DescribeInstanceHistoryEvents
DescribeInstanceHistoryEvents.summary: Queries the system events of Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances. When you call this operation, you can specify parameters, such as InstanceId and EventType, in the request. By default, non-active system events are queried.

DescribeInstanceMaintenanceAttributes.title: DescribeInstanceMaintenanceAttributes
DescribeInstanceMaintenanceAttributes.summary: Queries the maintenance attributes of an instance.

DescribeInstanceModificationPrice.title: DescribeInstanceModificationPrice
DescribeInstanceModificationPrice.summary: Queries the pricing information about newly attached subscription data disks or about the new instance types when you upgrade the configurations of unexpired subscription Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances.

DescribeInstanceMonitorData.title: DescribeInstanceMonitorData
DescribeInstanceMonitorData.summary: Queries the monitoring data of an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance. The monitoring data can include the vCPU utilization, CPU credits of the burstable instance, amount of received data traffic, amount of sent data traffic, and average bandwidth.

DescribeInstanceRamRole.title: DescribeInstanceRamRole
DescribeInstanceRamRole.summary: Queries the instance Resource Access Management (RAM) roles that are attached to Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances based on the instance IDs, or queries the ECS instances to which a specific instance RAM role is attached based on the name of the instance RAM role.

DescribeInstanceStatus.title: DescribeInstanceStatus
DescribeInstanceStatus.summary: Queries the status of one or more Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances. You can also call this operation to query the list of ECS instances that match the specified filter conditions.

DescribeInstanceTypeFamilies.title: DescribeInstanceTypeFamilies
DescribeInstanceTypeFamilies.summary: Queries the instance families provided by Elastic Compute Service (ECS). You can call the DescribeInstanceTypeFamilies operation to obtain information about different series of instance families. This helps you better understand the available instance types and choose appropriate instance types to create ECS instances.

DescribeInstanceTypes.title: DescribeInstanceTypes
DescribeInstanceTypes.summary: Queries the details of all instance types or a specific instance type provided by Elastic Compute Service (ECS). You can understand the specifications and performance of instance types based on the response and select an instance type that meets your business requirements.

DescribeInstanceVncUrl.title: DescribeInstanceVncUrl
DescribeInstanceVncUrl.summary: Queries the Virtual Network Computing (VNC) logon address of an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance.

DescribeInstances.title: DescribeInstances
DescribeInstances.summary: Queries Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances by various filter conditions. The details of the queried ECS instances are returned in the response.

DescribeInstancesFullStatus.title: DescribeInstancesFullStatus
DescribeInstancesFullStatus.summary: Queries the full status information of one or more Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances. The full status information includes the instance status and the status of instance system events. The instance status is the lifecycle status of instances. The status of instance system events is the health status of maintenance events.

DescribeInvocationResults.title: DescribeInvocationResults
DescribeInvocationResults.summary: Queries the execution results of one or more Cloud Assistant commands on Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances.

DescribeInvocations.title: DescribeInvocations
DescribeInvocations.summary: Queries the execution list and states of Cloud Assistant commands.

DescribeKeyPairs.title: DescribeKeyPairs
DescribeKeyPairs.summary: Queries one or more key pairs.

DescribeLaunchTemplateVersions.title: DescribeLaunchTemplateVersions
DescribeLaunchTemplateVersions.summary: Queries the information of launch template versions, such as the total number of launch templates, launch template names, and launch template version numbers.

DescribeLaunchTemplates.title: DescribeLaunchTemplates
DescribeLaunchTemplates.summary: Queries the information of one or more launch templates, such as the total number of launch templates, the creation time of each launch template, and the latest version number of each launch template. When you can this operation, you can specify parameters, such as TemplateTag, TemplateResourceGroupId, and LaunchTemplateId, in the request.

DescribeNetworkInterfaceAttribute.title: DescribeNetworkInterfaceAttribute
DescribeNetworkInterfaceAttribute.summary: Queries the details of an elastic network interface (ENI). When you call this operation, you can set the NetworkInterfaceId parameter to specify an ENI.

DescribeNetworkInterfacePermissions.title: DescribeNetworkInterfacePermissions
DescribeNetworkInterfacePermissions.summary: Queries the permissions on elastic network interfaces (ENIs) that are granted to an Alibaba Cloud partner (certified ISV) or an individual user.

DescribeNetworkInterfaces.title: DescribeNetworkInterfaces
DescribeNetworkInterfaces.summary: Queries the details of one or more Elastic Network Interface (ENIs).

DescribePortRangeListAssociations.title: DescribePortRangeListAssociations
DescribePortRangeListAssociations.summary: Queries the resources that are associated with a port list, such as security groups.

DescribePortRangeListEntries.title: DescribePortRangeListEntries
DescribePortRangeListEntries.summary: Queries the entries of a specified port list.

DescribePrefixListAssociations.title: DescribePrefixListAssociations
DescribePrefixListAssociations.summary: Queries information about resources that are associated with a prefix list, such as the resource IDs and types.

DescribePrefixListAttributes.title: DescribePrefixListAttributes
DescribePrefixListAttributes.summary: Queries the details of a prefix list, including the name, address family, maximum number of entries, and details of the entries.

DescribePrefixLists.title: DescribePrefixLists
DescribePrefixLists.summary: Queries the information of prefix lists.

DescribePrice.title: DescribePrice
DescribePrice.summary: Queries the most recent prices of specified resources. You can specify a resource type in the request, such as the Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance, cloud disk, dedicated host, elasticity assurance, and capacity reservation. You can also query the activity rules, prices, and discounts of resources.

DescribeRecommendInstanceType.title: DescribeRecommendInstanceType
DescribeRecommendInstanceType.summary: Queries alternative instance types of an instance type. This operation is in internal preview. This operation lists all alternative instance types of an instance type that has been or is planed to be retired.

DescribeRegions.title: DescribeRegions
DescribeRegions.summary: Queries Alibaba Cloud regions. When you call this operation, you can specify parameters, such as InstanceChargeType and ResourceType, in the request.

DescribeRenewalPrice.title: DescribeRenewalPrice
DescribeRenewalPrice.summary: Queries the renewal prices of Elastic Compute Service (ECS) resources. Renewal prices of only subscription resources can be queried.

DescribeReservedInstanceAutoRenewAttribu.title: DescribeReservedInstanceAutoRenewAttribute
DescribeReservedInstanceAutoRenewAttribu.summary: Queries the auto-renewal attributes of one or more reserved instances, including the auto-renewal duration and auto-renewal status.

DescribeReservedInstances.title: DescribeReservedInstances
DescribeReservedInstances.summary: Queries the details of reserved instances that you have purchased in a specific region. You can query the details of reserved instances based on parameters, such as tags and reserved instance attributes.

DescribeResourceByTags.title: DescribeResourceByTags
DescribeResourceByTags.summary: Queries resources by tag or resource type.

DescribeResourcesModification.title: DescribeResourcesModification
DescribeResourcesModification.summary: Queries available instance types or system disk categories in a specific zone before you change the instance type or system disk category of an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance.

DescribeSecurityGroupAttribute.title: DescribeSecurityGroupAttribute
DescribeSecurityGroupAttribute.summary: Queries the details of a specified security group and the security group rules of the security group.

DescribeSecurityGroupReferences.title: DescribeSecurityGroupReferences
DescribeSecurityGroupReferences.summary: Queries the security groups whose rules reference security groups as authorization objects.

DescribeSecurityGroups.title: DescribeSecurityGroups
DescribeSecurityGroups.summary: Queries the basic information of security groups. You can query the information by various filter conditions, such as the region ID, security group ID, and security group type.

DescribeSendFileResults.title: DescribeSendFileResults
DescribeSendFileResults.summary: Queries the files sent by Cloud Assistant and their status.

DescribeSnapshotGroups.title: DescribeSnapshotGroups
DescribeSnapshotGroups.summary: Queries the information of one or more snapshot-consistent groups, such as the status of the groups, IDs of the instances associated with the groups, and snapshot creation progress.

DescribeSnapshotLinks.title: DescribeSnapshotLinks
DescribeSnapshotLinks.summary: Queries the snapshot chains of cloud disks. A snapshot chain is a chain of all the snapshots created for a disk. A disk corresponds to a chain of snapshots.

DescribeSnapshotMonitorData.title: DescribeSnapshotMonitorData
DescribeSnapshotMonitorData.summary: Queries the monitoring data of snapshot sizes in a region within the last 30 days.

DescribeSnapshotPackage.title: DescribeSnapshotPackage
DescribeSnapshotPackage.summary: Queries the Object Storage Service (OSS) storage plans that you purchased in an Alibaba Cloud region. OSS storage plans can be used to offset the storage fees for standard snapshots instead of local snapshots.

DescribeSnapshots.title: DescribeSnapshots
DescribeSnapshots.summary: Queries the details of cloud disk snapshots. The details include the status of the snapshots, the amount of remaining time required to create the snapshots, and the retention period of the automatic snapshots in days.

DescribeSnapshotsUsage.title: DescribeSnapshotsUsage
DescribeSnapshotsUsage.summary: Queries the number of snapshots that are stored in a region and the total size of the snapshots.

DescribeSpotAdvice.title: DescribeSpotAdvice
DescribeSpotAdvice.summary: Queries information about spot instances in a region in the previous 30 days. The information includes the average release rate of spot instances and the percentage of the average spot instance price relative to the pay-as-you-go instance price.

DescribeSpotPriceHistory.title: DescribeSpotPriceHistory
DescribeSpotPriceHistory.summary: Queries the historical prices of spot instances within up to the previous 30 days. You can set the maximum price of a spot instance based on the historical prices.

DescribeStorageCapacityUnits.title: DescribeStorageCapacityUnits
DescribeStorageCapacityUnits.summary: Queries the details of storage capacity units (SCUs). In the request, you can specify the name, status, or capacity of each SCU.

DescribeTags.title: DescribeTags
DescribeTags.summary: Queries the available tags. You can specify multiple filter conditions, such as a resource type, a resource ID, a tag key, and a tag value, to query tags. The specified filter conditions have logical AND relations.

DescribeTaskAttribute.title: DescribeTaskAttribute
DescribeTaskAttribute.summary: Queries the details of an asynchronous task. The asynchronous tasks that you can query by calling this operation are the tasks generated by the ImportImage, ExportImage, and ModifyDiskSpec operations.

DescribeTasks.title: DescribeTasks
DescribeTasks.summary: Queries the progress of one or more asynchronous tasks.

DescribeTerminalSessions.title: DescribeTerminalSessions
DescribeTerminalSessions.summary: Queries the session records of Elastic Compute Service (ECS) Session Manager.

DescribeUserData.title: DescribeUserData
DescribeUserData.summary: Queries the user data of an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance.

DescribeZones.title: DescribeZones
DescribeZones.summary: Queries Alibaba Cloud regions. You can specify parameters, such as InstanceChargeType and ResourceType, in the request.

DetachClassicLinkVpc.title: DetachClassicLinkVpc
DetachClassicLinkVpc.summary: Unlinks an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance that resides in the classic network from a virtual private cloud (VPC) by closing the ClassicLink connection between the instance and the VPC. After the instance is unlinked from the VPC, the instance can no longer communicate with instances in the VPC.

DetachDisk.title: DetachDisk
DetachDisk.summary: Detaches a pay-as-you-go data disk or a system disk from an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance.

DetachInstanceRamRole.title: DetachInstanceRamRole
DetachInstanceRamRole.summary: Detaches instance Resource Access Management (RAM) roles from Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances.

DetachKeyPair.title: DetachKeyPair
DetachKeyPair.summary: Unbinds an SSH key pair from Linux Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances.

DetachNetworkInterface.title: DetachNetworkInterface
DetachNetworkInterface.summary: Detach an elastic network interface (ENI) from an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance.

DisableActivation.title: DisableActivation
DisableActivation.summary: To prevent an activation code from being leaked, you can call the DisableActivation operation to disable the activation code. Disabled activation codes cannot be used to register new managed instances. However, managed instances that are already registered are not affected.

DisableDiskEncryptionByDefault.title: DisableDiskEncryptionByDefault
DisableDiskEncryptionByDefault.summary: Disables account-level default encryption of Elastic Block Storage (EBS) resources in a region. After you disable account-level default encryption of EBS resources in a region, the encryption status of existing disks in the region does not change. When you create a disk, you can still choose to encrypt the disk.

DisableNetworkInterfaceQoS.title: DisableNetworkInterfaceQoS
DisableNetworkInterfaceQoS.summary: Disables Elastic Network Interface (ENI) QoS speed setting.

EnableDiskEncryptionByDefault.title: EnableDiskEncryptionByDefault
EnableDiskEncryptionByDefault.summary: Enables the Account-level Elastic Block Storage (EBS) Default Encryption feature in a region.

EnableNetworkInterfaceQoS.title: EnableNetworkInterfaceQoS
EnableNetworkInterfaceQoS.summary: Enable or modify Elastic Network Interface (ENI) QoS rate limit settings

ExportImage.title: ExportImage
ExportImage.summary: Exports a custom image to an Object Storage Service (OSS) bucket in the same region.

GetInstanceConsoleOutput.title: GetInstanceConsoleOutput
GetInstanceConsoleOutput.summary: Queries the command output of an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance. The returned command output is encoded in Base64.

GetInstanceScreenshot.title: GetInstanceScreenshot
GetInstanceScreenshot.summary: Obtains the screenshots of an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance.

ImportImage.title: ImportImage
ImportImage.summary: Imports an on-premise image to Elastic Compute Service (ECS). The imported image exists as a custom image in the destination region. You can use the imported image to create ECS instances by calling the RunInstances operation or replace the system disk of an ECS instance by calling the ReplaceSystemDisk operation.

ImportKeyPair.title: ImportKeyPair
ImportKeyPair.summary: Imports the public key of a Rivest-Shamir-Adleman (RSA) key pair that is generated by a third-party tool. After the key pair is imported, Alibaba Cloud stores the public key. You must securely store the private key.

InstallCloudAssistant.title: InstallCloudAssistant
InstallCloudAssistant.summary: Installs Cloud Assistant Agent on Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances. After you install Cloud Assistant Agent on ECS instances, restart the instances for the installation to take effect.

InvokeCommand.title: InvokeCommand
InvokeCommand.summary: Specify parameters such as CommandId, InstanceId, and ResourceGroupId to trigger a Cloud Assistant command for one or more ECS instances.

JoinResourceGroup.title: JoinResourceGroup
JoinResourceGroup.summary: Adds an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) resource or service to a resource group.

JoinSecurityGroup.title: JoinSecurityGroup
JoinSecurityGroup.summary: Adds an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance or an elastic network interface (ENI) to a specified security group.

LeaveSecurityGroup.title: LeaveSecurityGroup
LeaveSecurityGroup.summary: Removes an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance or an elastic network interface (ENI) from a security group.

ListPluginStatus.title: ListPluginStatus
ListPluginStatus.summary: Queries the states of Cloud Assistant plug-ins on Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances.

ListTagResources.title: ListTagResources
ListTagResources.summary: Queries the tags that are added to one or more Elastic Compute Service (ECS) resources.

ModifyAutoProvisioningGroup.title: ModifyAutoProvisioningGroup
ModifyAutoProvisioningGroup.summary: Modifies the configurations of an auto provisioning group.

ModifyAutoSnapshotPolicyEx.title: ModifyAutoSnapshotPolicyEx
ModifyAutoSnapshotPolicyEx.summary: Modifies an automatic snapshot policy. For example, you can change the points in time of the day at which to create automatic snapshots, days of the week on which to create automatic snapshots, and retention period of automatic snapshots for the automatic snapshot policy.

ModifyCapacityReservation.title: ModifyCapacityReservation
ModifyCapacityReservation.summary: Modifies the information of a capacity reservation, including the name, description, release mode, and the total number of Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances for which capacity is reserved.

ModifyCloudAssistantSettings.title: ModifyCloudAssistantSettings
ModifyCloudAssistantSettings.summary: Modifies the configurations of a Cloud Assistant feature.

ModifyCommand.title: ModifyCommand
ModifyCommand.summary: Modifies the parameters of a Cloud Assistant command.

ModifyDedicatedHostAttribute.title: ModifyDedicatedHostAttribute
ModifyDedicatedHostAttribute.summary: Modifies the information about a dedicated host, such as the name, description, and instance migration policy that is applied when the dedicated host fails.

ModifyDedicatedHostAutoReleaseTime.title: ModifyDedicatedHostAutoReleaseTime
ModifyDedicatedHostAutoReleaseTime.summary: Sets the automatic release time for a pay-as-you-go dedicated host or cancels its automatic release.

ModifyDedicatedHostAutoRenewAttribute.title: ModifyDedicatedHostAutoRenewAttribute
ModifyDedicatedHostAutoRenewAttribute.summary: Enables or disables auto-renewal for one or more subscription dedicated hosts.

ModifyDedicatedHostClusterAttribute.title: ModifyDedicatedHostClusterAttribute
ModifyDedicatedHostClusterAttribute.summary: Modifies the information of a dedicated host group, including the name, description, and properties.

ModifyDedicatedHostsChargeType.title: ModifyDedicatedHostsChargeType
ModifyDedicatedHostsChargeType.summary: Changes the billing method of dedicated hosts.

ModifyDeploymentSetAttribute.title: ModifyDeploymentSetAttribute
ModifyDeploymentSetAttribute.summary: Modifies the name and description of a deployment set.

ModifyDiskAttribute.title: ModifyDiskAttribute
ModifyDiskAttribute.summary: Modifies the name, description, release behavior with ECS instance, snapshot deletion on disk removal, automatic snapshot policy feature, and performance burst feature for one or more block storage devices.

ModifyDiskChargeType.title: ModifyDiskChargeType
ModifyDiskChargeType.summary: Converts the billing method of a data disk attached to a subscription ECS instance between pay-as-you-go and subscription.

ModifyDiskDefaultKMSKeyId.title: ModifyDiskDefaultKMSKeyId
ModifyDiskDefaultKMSKeyId.summary: Changes the Key Management Service (KMS) key used by the Account-level Elastic Block Storage (EBS) Default Encryption feature in a region.

ModifyDiskDeployment.title: ModifyDiskDeployment
ModifyDiskDeployment.summary: Migrates disks to or from a dedicated block storage cluster, or migrates disks between different dedicated block storage clusters.

ModifyDiskSpec.title: ModifyDiskSpec
ModifyDiskSpec.summary: Changes the disk category of a cloud disk or the performance level of an Enterprise SSD (ESSD). You cannot change the disk categories of Regional ESSDs, basic disks, elastic ephemeral disks, and local disks.

ModifyElasticityAssurance.title: ModifyElasticityAssurance
ModifyElasticityAssurance.summary: Modifies information about an elasticity assurance, including the name, description, and capacity. Only capacity scale-in is supported .

ModifyElasticityAssuranceAutoRenewAttrib.title: ModifyElasticityAssuranceAutoRenewAttribute
ModifyElasticityAssuranceAutoRenewAttrib.summary: Modifies the auto-renewal attribute of elasticity assurances.

ModifyHpcClusterAttribute.title: ModifyHpcClusterAttribute
ModifyHpcClusterAttribute.summary: Modifies the description of a high performance computing (HPC) cluster.

ModifyImageAttribute.title: ModifyImageAttribute
ModifyImageAttribute.summary: Modifies the attributes of a custom image, such as the image family, name, boot mode, and status and whether the image supports the Non-Volatile Memory Express (NVMe) protocol. When you call this operation, you can specify parameters, such as ImageId and ImageFamily, in the request.

ModifyImageSharePermission.title: ModifyImageSharePermission
ModifyImageSharePermission.summary: Modifies the share permissions on an image. You can share your custom images with other Alibaba Cloud accounts or publish the images as community images.

ModifyInstanceAttachmentAttributes.title: ModifyInstanceAttachmentAttributes
ModifyInstanceAttachmentAttributes.summary: Changes the type of the private pool for an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance.

ModifyInstanceAttribute.title: ModifyInstanceAttribute
ModifyInstanceAttribute.summary: Modifies the attributes of an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance, such as the password, name, description, hostname, security groups, maximum transmission unit (MTU), and user data of the instance.

ModifyInstanceAutoReleaseTime.title: ModifyInstanceAutoReleaseTime
ModifyInstanceAutoReleaseTime.summary: Changes the automatic release time of a pay-as-you-go or spot instance or cancels the automatic release of the instance.

ModifyInstanceAutoRenewAttribute.title: ModifyInstanceAutoRenewAttribute
ModifyInstanceAutoRenewAttribute.summary: Configures auto-renewal for subscription instances to help reduce the maintenance workloads on instance expiration.

ModifyInstanceChargeType.title: ModifyInstanceChargeType
ModifyInstanceChargeType.summary: Changes the billing method of Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances in batches.

ModifyInstanceDeployment.title: ModifyInstanceDeployment
ModifyInstanceDeployment.summary: Changes the deployment set of an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance or migrates an ECS instance to a dedicated host. You can change the instance type of an ECS instance when you migrate the instance.

ModifyInstanceMaintenanceAttributes.title: ModifyInstanceMaintenanceAttributes
ModifyInstanceMaintenanceAttributes.summary: Modifies the maintenance attributes of an instance.

ModifyInstanceMetadataOptions.title: ModifyInstanceMetadataOptions
ModifyInstanceMetadataOptions.summary: Modifies the metadata access configurations of instances in a specific region, including whether to enable the metadata access channel and whether to forcefully use the security hardening mode to access instance metadata.

ModifyInstanceNetworkSpec.title: ModifyInstanceNetworkSpec
ModifyInstanceNetworkSpec.summary: Modifies the network configurations of an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance, such as the public bandwidth, assignment or unassignment of a static public IP address (also known as system-assigned or auto-assigned public IP address), and billing method for network usage. You can call this operation to upgrade or downgrade the network configurations of ECS instances.

ModifyInstanceSpec.title: ModifyInstanceSpec
ModifyInstanceSpec.summary: Changes the instance type or public bandwidth of a pay-as-you-go Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance.

ModifyInstanceVncPasswd.title: ModifyInstanceVncPasswd
ModifyInstanceVncPasswd.summary: Changes the Virtual Network Computing (VNC) password of an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance.

ModifyInstanceVpcAttribute.title: ModifyInstanceVpcAttribute
ModifyInstanceVpcAttribute.summary: Changes the virtual private cloud (VPC), private IP address, security groups, or vSwitch of an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance located in a VPC.

ModifyInvocationAttribute.title: ModifyInvocationAttribute
ModifyInvocationAttribute.summary: Modifies the execution information of a Cloud Assistant scheduled command task, including modifying the content and execution frequency of the command and adding Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances or Alibaba Cloud managed instances to the command task.

ModifyLaunchTemplateDefaultVersion.title: ModifyLaunchTemplateDefaultVersion
ModifyLaunchTemplateDefaultVersion.summary: Changes the default version of a launch template. When you call this operation, you can specify DefaultVersionNumber in the request. If you do not specify a version when you create Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances based on a launch template, the default version of the launch template is used.

ModifyManagedInstance.title: ModifyManagedInstance
ModifyManagedInstance.summary: Modifies the information of a managed instance.

ModifyNetworkInterfaceAttribute.title: ModifyNetworkInterfaceAttribute
ModifyNetworkInterfaceAttribute.summary: Modifies the attributes of an elastic network interface (ENI), such as the number of queues supported by the ENI, the security groups to which the ENI belongs, the queue depth, the communication mode, and whether to retain the ENI when the Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance to which the ENI is attached is released.

ModifyPortRangeList.title: ModifyPortRangeList
ModifyPortRangeList.summary: Modifies the name and entries of a port list. You can call this operation to add, modify, and remove entries for a port list.

ModifyPrefixList.title: ModifyPrefixList
ModifyPrefixList.summary: Modifies the name, description, or entries of a prefix list. You can add, modify, and delete entries in the prefix list.

ModifyPrepayInstanceSpec.title: ModifyPrepayInstanceSpec
ModifyPrepayInstanceSpec.summary: Changes the instance type of a subscription Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance. You can upgrade or downgrade the instance type. The new instance type takes effect for the entire lifecycle of the subscription ECS instance.

ModifyReservedInstanceAttribute.title: ModifyReservedInstanceAttribute
ModifyReservedInstanceAttribute.summary: Modifies the attributes of a reserved instance, such as the name and description of the instance.

ModifyReservedInstanceAutoRenewAttribute.title: ModifyReservedInstanceAutoRenewAttribute
ModifyReservedInstanceAutoRenewAttribute.summary: Modifies the auto-renewal attributes of reserved instances. You can cancel or disable the auto-renewal feature for reserved instances.

ModifyReservedInstances.title: ModifyReservedInstances
ModifyReservedInstances.summary: Modifies the configurations of a reserved instance, such as the instance type, quantity, and zone, to split, merge, or change the scope of the reserved instance.

ModifySecurityGroupAttribute.title: ModifySecurityGroupAttribute
ModifySecurityGroupAttribute.summary: Modifies the name or description of a specific security group.

ModifySecurityGroupEgressRule.title: ModifySecurityGroupEgressRule
ModifySecurityGroupEgressRule.summary: Modifies an outbound security group rule in a security group.

ModifySecurityGroupPolicy.title: ModifySecurityGroupPolicy
ModifySecurityGroupPolicy.summary: Modifies the internal access control policy of a basic security group.

ModifySecurityGroupRule.title: ModifySecurityGroupRule
ModifySecurityGroupRule.summary: Modifies an inbound security group rule in a security group.

ModifySnapshotAttribute.title: ModifySnapshotAttribute
ModifySnapshotAttribute.summary: Modifies the name, description, or retention period of a snapshot.

ModifySnapshotCategory.title: ModifySnapshotCategory
ModifySnapshotCategory.summary: Changes the type of a snapshot. You can call this operation to convert a standard snapshot into an archive snapshot.

ModifySnapshotGroup.title: ModifySnapshotGroup
ModifySnapshotGroup.summary: Modifies the name and description of a snapshot-consistent group.

ModifyStorageCapacityUnitAttribute.title: ModifyStorageCapacityUnitAttribute
ModifyStorageCapacityUnitAttribute.summary: Modifies the name or description of a storage capacity unit (SCU).

PurchaseElasticityAssurance.title: PurchaseElasticityAssurance
PurchaseElasticityAssurance.summary: Purchases an elasticity assurance that is not in the Active state and for which resources are prepared.

PurchaseReservedInstancesOffering.title: PurchaseReservedInstancesOffering
PurchaseReservedInstancesOffering.summary: Purchases a regional or zonal reserved instance to offset the bills of pay-as-you-go Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances.

PurchaseStorageCapacityUnit.title: PurchaseStorageCapacityUnit
PurchaseStorageCapacityUnit.summary: Purchases one or more storage capacity units (SCUs).

ReActivateInstances.title: ReActivateInstances
ReActivateInstances.summary: Reactivates a pay-as-you-go Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance that has expired or has been reclaimed due to overdue payments.

ReInitDisk.title: ReInitDisk
ReInitDisk.summary: Re-initializes a cloud disk to the state when the cloud disk was created.

RebootInstance.title: RebootInstance
RebootInstance.summary: Restarts an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance.

RebootInstances.title: RebootInstances
RebootInstances.summary: Restarts Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances. When you call this operation, you can configure parameters to specify a batch operation mode and whether to forcefully restart the instances.

RedeployDedicatedHost.title: RedeployDedicatedHost
RedeployDedicatedHost.summary: Migrates Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances from a failed dedicated host.

RedeployInstance.title: RedeployInstance
RedeployInstance.summary: Redeploys an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance. You can call this operation to redeploy an ECS instance when the instance receives a system event notification.

ReleaseDedicatedHost.title: ReleaseDedicatedHost
ReleaseDedicatedHost.summary: Releases a pay-as-you-go Dedicated Host or an expired subscription Dedicated Host.

ReleasePublicIpAddress.title: ReleasePublicIpAddress
ReleasePublicIpAddress.summary: Disassociates a public IP address from an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance.

RemoveTags.title: RemoveTags
RemoveTags.summary: Removes tags from a resource, such as an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance, disk, snapshot, image, or security group.

RenewDedicatedHosts.title: RenewDedicatedHosts
RenewDedicatedHosts.summary: Renews one or more subscription dedicated hosts.

RenewElasticityAssurances.title: RenewElasticityAssurances
RenewElasticityAssurances.summary: Renews elasticity assurances that you purchased.

RenewInstance.title: RenewInstance
RenewInstance.summary: Renews a subscription Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance. You can specify a renewal period or renew the instance to a unified expiration date.

RenewReservedInstances.title: RenewReservedInstances
RenewReservedInstances.summary: Renews one or more reserved instances. When you renew reserved instances, you can specify a validity period (renewal period) and whether to enable auto-renewal for the reserved instances.

ReplaceSystemDisk.title: ReplaceSystemDisk
ReplaceSystemDisk.summary: Replaces the operating system (system disk) of an ECS instance. After the operating system of the ECS instance is replaced, the original system disk of the instance is released and a new system disk is generated for the instance. This causes the ID of the system disk to change.

ReportInstancesStatus.title: ReportInstancesStatus
ReportInstancesStatus.summary: Reports an exception on Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances. You can report the same exception on multiple ECS instances or on multiple disks of an ECS instance.

ResetDisk.title: ResetDisk
ResetDisk.summary: Rolls back a cloud disk to a snapshot from an earlier point in time.

ResetDiskDefaultKMSKeyId.title: ResetDiskDefaultKMSKeyId
ResetDiskDefaultKMSKeyId.summary: Resets the Key Management Service (KMS) key used by Account-level Elastic Block Storage (EBS) Default Encryption in a region to the service key.

ResetDisks.title: ResetDisks
ResetDisks.summary: Rolls back one or more disks by using a snapshot-consistent group.

ResizeDisk.title: ResizeDisk
ResizeDisk.summary: Resizes a system disk or a data disk.

RevokeSecurityGroup.title: RevokeSecurityGroup
RevokeSecurityGroup.summary: Deletes inbound security group rules from a specific security group.

RevokeSecurityGroupEgress.title: RevokeSecurityGroupEgress
RevokeSecurityGroupEgress.summary: Deletes outbound security group rules from a specified security group.

RunCommand.title: RunCommand
RunCommand.summary: Creates and runs a Cloud Assistant command on one or more Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances. Shell, PowerShell, and batch commands are supported. You can run the command based on a schedule, include custom parameters in the command, or run the command in containers on instances.

RunInstances.title: RunInstances
RunInstances.summary: Batch creates Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances. You can automatically start, assign public IP addresses to, and specify an automatic release time for the instances.

SendFile.title: SendFile
SendFile.summary: Sends a file to one or more Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances.

StartImagePipelineExecution.title: StartImagePipelineExecution
StartImagePipelineExecution.summary: Executes an image creation task (image building task) by using an image template.

StartInstance.title: StartInstance
StartInstance.summary: Starts an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance. You can specify the ID of an ECS instance and parameters, such as InitLocalDisk, in the request based on your business requirements to start the instance.

StartInstances.title: StartInstances
StartInstances.summary: Starts Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances that are in the Stopped state.

StartTerminalSession.title: StartTerminalSession
StartTerminalSession.summary: Creates a session by using the session management feature. When you call this operation, you can include the ID of an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance in the request to create a WebSocket session for the instance. The URL of the WebSocket session returned by the operation can be used to connect to the instance.

StopInstance.title: StopInstance
StopInstance.summary: Stops an Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instance. You can specify parameters to determine whether to forcefully stop the instance and the stop mode.

StopInstances.title: StopInstances
StopInstances.summary: Stops Elastic Compute Service (ECS) instances. You can specify parameters to determine whether to forcefully stop the instances and the stop mode.

StopInvocation.title: StopInvocation
StopInvocation.summary:
\\*   If you stop the process of a command that runs only once, the executions that have started are not interrupted. The executions that have not started are canceled.
\\*   If you stop the process of a scheduled invocation command, the executions that have started are not interrupted. However, the execution does not start in the next period.

TagResources.title: TagResources
TagResources.summary: Creates and adds tags to Elastic Compute Service (ECS) resources.

UnassignIpv6Addresses.title: UnassignIpv6Addresses
UnassignIpv6Addresses.summary: Unassigns one or more IPv6 addresses from an elastic network interface (ENI).

UnassignPrivateIpAddresses.title: UnassignPrivateIpAddresses
UnassignPrivateIpAddresses.summary: Unassigns secondary private IP addresses from an elastic network interface (ENI).

UntagResources.title: UntagResources
UntagResources.summary: Removes tags from Elastic Compute Service (ECS) resources. After a tag is removed from a resource, the tag is automatically deleted if it is not added to other resources.
